business.headline: Sensex crashes 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 5 lakh croreThe bloodbath on Dalal Street has wiped off nearly Rs 5 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Government may slash petrol, diesel prices as global crude oil rates fallUS crude oil prices dropped by more than 1% on Wednesday, falling below $70 per barrel. Brent crude prices followed suit, falling by $1 to reach $72.75 per barrel.
Bina Modi to vote on behalf of family trust at Godfrey Phillips AGMThe Delhi High Court recently allowed Bina to cast her vote on behalf of the trust, which holds a 47.5% stake in the company.

Goldman Sachs gives SBI 'sell' rating with revised target price. Know whyThe brokerage highlighted a growing risk-reward imbalance for SBI's stock, driven by challenges in maintaining a strong return on assets.

India's household food spending dips to less than 50%: ReportThe change in spending, highlighted in a recent report by the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), signals a shift in how Indian families allocate their monthly budgets.
Sensex, Nifty down 1%: What's behind today's stock market turbulence?Today's market turbulence is partly linked to investor jitters ahead of the US non-farm payrolls report expected later today.
Explained: Why Vodafone Idea shares tumbled over 14% today As of 11:51 am, Vodafone Idea's shares were trading at Rs13.60, down nearly 10%.
Boss Packaging Solutions makes debut on NSE SME at 25% premiumBoss Packaging Solutions listing: The stock was listed at Rs 82.5 on the NSE SME, marking a 25% premium over its IPO price of Rs 66.
Sensex down nearly 900 points, investors lose over Rs 4 lakh croreStock market turmoil: At 11:27 am, the Sensex was down 883.93 points to 81,317.23, while the Nifty50 fell 255.95 points to 24,889.15.

Rekha Jhunjhunwala-backed Baazar Style Retail lists a flat on Dalal Street Baazar Style Retail listing: Baazar Style Retail's IPO received strong interest from investors, with an overall subscription of nearly 41 times by the time it closed.
Sensex falls nearly 600 points, Nifty tumbles ahead of key US jobs dataThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 553.9 points to 81,647.26 at 9:55 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 156.30 points to 24,988.80.

Government starts selling onions at Rs 35/kg in Delhi and Mumbai. Check details The National Cooperative Consumer's Federation (NCCF) and the National Agricultural Cooperative Marketing Federation have started selling onions at Rs 35 per kilogram through special vans in Delhi and Mumbai.
CSK hits it out of the park: IPL profit soars, check out jaw-dropping figuresThe overall revenue for Chennai Super Kings Cricket Ltd grew by 131% to Rs 676.40 crore, up from Rs 292.34 crore in FY23.
NPS scheme for minors to launch in 2 weeks. Details here NPS Vatsalya is a modified version of the National Pension System (NPS), designed specifically for minors.

Sebi employees stage silent protest at Mumbai office against 'toxic environment'Visuals showed scores of disgruntled employees gathered outside the main building, but within the Sebi headquarters' campus, staging a peaceful protest against the board's top management.

PM asks Singapore business leaders to look for investment opportunities in IndiaDuring the interaction, PM Modi said India had made transformative progress in the last 10 years and would continue on the same path given its strengths of political stability, policy predictability, ease of doing business, and its reform-oriented economic agenda.
NRIs face double tax if they miss filing this form. Check detailsNRIs may face double taxation on the same income if their claim for tax relief under DTAA is denied.

Bizarre IPOs of 2024: SME listings that no one saw comingWhile mainboard IPOs are the ones which attract the big bucks, the trend this year has been different with retail inventors breaking their banks for SME IPOs in a bizarre phenomenon.

Reliance Industries approves 1:1 bonus shares for shareholdersThe announcement was made following the company's annual general meeting (AGM), where chairman Mukesh Ambani, had hinted at this move as a way to reward investors.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as cautious investors await US economic dataThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 151.48 points to close at 82,201.16, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 53.60 points lower to end at 25,145.10.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Congress's fresh charge on Sebi chief: Got rent income from firm under probeCongress's Pawan Khera alleged that Madhabi Buch gave one of her properties on rent to a Mumbai company whose affiliated firm was under probe by Sebi.

Vinesh Phogat, Bajrang Punia to join Congress shortly ahead of Haryana electionThe development comes mere days after the two wrestlers met with the party's leader, Rahul Gandhi, in New Delhi on September 4.

People will decide whether we will become God or not: RSS chief Mohan BhagwatAt an event in Pune, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat also spoke on the situation in violence-hit Manipur, saying locals were doubtful about their security.

How NSG commandos ended plane-hijack crisis in Amritsar in 5 minutesIn 1993, an Indian Airlines Delhi-Srinagar with 141 people on board was hijacked by a Hizb-ul-Mujahideen terrorist, who hid two pistols in the plaster moulds on his legs. As the plane stopped at Amritsar, NSG commandos stormed IC 427 and ended the hostage crisis in just five minutes. This was in sharp contrast to the IC 814 Kandahar hijacking of 1999.

Can Ozempic delay ageing? Experts weigh in on new study Ozempic, the much-talked-about drug for diabetes management and subsequent weight loss, can delay ageing and improve heart health, says a new study.

Woman raped on busy Ujjain road, bystanders film it, post video onlineThe accused coaxed the woman to drink alcohol and when she was intoxicated, he took her to a roadside shelter and raped her. An eyewitness filmed the incident and posted the video online, where it quickly went viral.

Donald Trump says will save TikTok if voted to power. He had banned it in 2020Donald Trump, who had banned TikTok when he was US President, has vowed to "save" the Chinese-owned platform in country. Interestingly, Trump is now himself on the platform, posting regularly.

Chinks in INDIA bloc? AAP's Delhi MLA joins CongressRajendra Pal Gautam, a prominent Dalit leader and MLA from Delhi's Seemapuri, joined the Congress today. The development comes amid ongoing alliance talks between the AAP and Congress for the upcoming Haryana assembly polls.

This Rs 5-crore Bihar hospital has not treated a single patient in 10 yearsA government hospital in Bihar, built at a cost of Rs 5 crore and equipped with modern facilities, has become a derelict structure abandoned for almost 10 years even without an inauguration.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.
Sensex, Nifty down 1%: What's behind today's stock market turbulence?Today's market turbulence is partly linked to investor jitters ahead of the US non-farm payrolls report expected later today.

Smirking Putin backs Kamala Harris for President, calls her laugh 'infectious'US elections: Vladimir Putin, tongue firmly in cheek, said he will support Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris, citing her "expressive and infectious" laughter as a sign that she will not impose more sanctions on Russia.

Pickleball Boom: The trendy, social sport is winning hearts in India tooPickleball is booming worldwide, and India is no exception. Once played in parking lots and alleys, it's now entering the professional era. Pioneers Sunil Valavakar and Manish Rao, in conversation with IndiaToday.in, highlight the sport's rapid growth and its ability to transcend age groups and make a meaningful impact on enthusiasts' lives.

No relief for ex-RG Kar principal as Supreme Court gives nod to CBI probeDr Sandip Ghosh, former principal of RG Kar Hospital, where a trainee doctor was killed, has been arrested by the CBI in connection with alleged financial irregularities.

Kangana Ranaut heartbroken as 'Emergency' gets postponedActor-politician Kangana Ranaut announced that her directorial 'Emergency' has been postponed. The actor mentioned that the team is waiting for the certificate from the censor board.

Naveen Patnaik's party expels Rajya Sabha MP for 'anti-party activities'Biju Janata Dal (BJD) on Friday announced that the party has expelled its Rajya Sabha MP Sujeet Kumar for 'anti-party activities'.

Shutters down at AnandTech and slow fading of internet we once knewWebsites close. Things end. Yet, one reason why the closure of AnandTech feels different — and even personal to many — is because of the outsized role it has played.

Sunita Williams closes Starliner's hatch to send it home empty Williams and Wilmore removed Starliner's crew seats to optimize space for cargo storage. This modification allows for more efficient packing of materials destined for return to Earth.
Emergency landing for Greece-bound flight after drunk passenger calls captain 'rubbish' Major drama unfolded onboard as a drunk passenger disrupted the flight and called the captain "rubbish".

AAP, Congress hold talks for Haryana poll deal, discussion with Rahul Gandhi todayAAP MP Raghav Chadha met Congress leader Deepak Babaria and possibly speak to Rahul Gandhi about the Haryana alliance today.

Watch: Salman Khan shoots for 'Bigg Boss 18' as he recovers from broken ribsSalman Khan shot for 'Bigg Boss 18' despite two broken ribs. In several videos from the sets, the actor was seen holding on to his ribs as he posed for the paparazzi.

Another wolf attack in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, 10-year-old boy injuredA fresh wolf attack occurred in Bahraich, Uttar Pradesh, on Thursday night, in which a 10-year-old boy sustained facial injuries.

Paralympics 2024, Day 9 Live:  Dipesh Kumar in action in Men's Javelin Throw - F54 FinalParalympics 2024, Day 9 Live: Yash Kumar has begun the day by qualifying for the semi-final of Men's Kayak Single 200M semi-final finishing sixth in his heat. Prachi Yadav also qualified for the semi-final of Women's Va'a Single 200m - VL2 Heats. Meanwhile, Dipesh Kumar is in action in Men's Javelin Throw - F54 Final.

Ben Stokes defends Ollie Pope's dry run, calls out 'English culture towards sport'Ben Stoke defended Ollie Pope for not being able to score runs in the last two Tests against Sri Lanka. He also called out the English culture towards the sport amid criticism for Pope.

Shabana Azmi takes a dig at OTT platforms for 'running after established stars'Shabana Azmi celebrated the 49th anniversary of 'Nishant' and criticised OTT platforms for their focus on established stars, urging more support for new talent. She highlighted Shyam Benegal's role in nurturing newcomers, contrasting it with current OTT trends.

'Panchayat' Tamil remake, 'Thalaivettiyaan Paalayam', to release soonThe Tamil remake of 'Panchayat', titled 'Thalaivettiyaan Paalayam', is set to stream on Prime Video from September 20, offering a heartwarming and comedic glimpse into rural Tamil Nadu.

Taylor Swift joins boyfriend Travis Kelce's father Ed to support him at NFL gamePop icon Taylor Swift attended her boyfriend Travis Kelce's Kansas City Chiefs game against the Baltimore Ravens on Thursday. In a viral video, Taylor can be seen sharing the stands with Travis's father, Ed Kelce.

Salman Khan shoots promo for 'Bigg Boss 18', hints at 'past and future' themeSalman Khan filmed a promo for 'Bigg Boss 18', which is set to air in October. Actors like Zaan Khan and Anjali Anand are speculated to be a part of the show.

sports.headline: R Ashwin highlights Shan Masood-Babar Azam conundrum in Pakistan CricketIndia off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin highlighted a major issue in Pakistan cricket with Shan Masood captaining he poster boy of Pakistan, Babar Azam.

Never said I wanted to compete in both Olympics and Paralympics: Sumit AntilParalympics 2024: Speaking to IndiaToday.in, javelin star Sumit Antil said he was not happy with his effort in Paris. Despite defending his title with a gold medal, Sumit rued missing another world record. The Haryana athlete, supported by GoSports Foundation, cleared the air around his plans for the future in a candid chat.

R Ashwin hails Tamil Nadu teammate Baba Indrajith's fighting 72 in Duleep TrophyRavichandran Ashwin hailed his Tamil Nadu teammate Baba Indrajith for his gritty knock for India C in the Duleep Trophy tournament. Indrajith scored 72 runs in IndiaC's first innings.

Concussion sub and other new ISL rules ahead of 2024-25 seasonThe Indian Super League (ISL) introduces new rules for the 2024-2025 season, including concussion substitutions and the ability to challenge wrongful red cards, aiming to improve fairness, player safety, and the development of homegrown talent.

England vs Sri Lanka 3rd Test match Live streaming: When and where to watch liveThe 3rd Test match between England and Sri Lanka will be played at The Oval. Find out all the live streaming details of the last match of the English summer.

The moment highlighted his incredible journey, solidifying his status as one of football's all-time greats.

Duleep Trophy: Anantapur stadium packed, Chinnaswamy stands in Bengaluru emptyDuleep Trophy: Huge crowd turned up at the Anantapur stadium in Andhra Pradesh for India C vs India D match. Meanwhile, the stands at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru were empty.

Messi's heartfelt farewell to Di Maria on retirement: We'll miss you a lotLionel Messi delivered an emotional tribute to Angel Di Maria at Estadio Mâs Monumental, honoring his 16-year Argentina career. The farewell left Di Maria in tears, marking the end of an era in Argentine football.

Vikram Rathour, Rangana Herath to help New Zealand prepare for Test season in Asia New Zealand Cricket have onboarded Vikram Rathour and Rangana Herath to help them prepare for the upcoming Test season in Asia.

Aryna Sabalenka ready for Final after 'missed opportunity' last yearAryna Sabalenka, determined to avenge last year's heartbreak, secured her second consecutive US Open final spot. Ready to "give it her all," she faces Jessica Pegula in a high-stakes showdown for her first US Open title.

Jessica Pegula credits 'small momentum flip moments' for maiden US Open semis winJessica Pegula credited small momentum flip moments which contributed to her first-ever win in the US Open semi-final. She beat Karolina Muchova 1-6, 6-4, 6-2.

Curtly Ambrose picks Virat Kohli among batters he would love to bowl againstLegendary West Indies fast bowler Curtly Ambrose picked star batter Virat Kohli among batters he would love to bowl against in international cricket.

ICC announces Player of the Month nominees, no Indians named in both categoriesThe ICC announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of August. However, no Indian made a cut to the nomination for both men's and women's categories.

US Open: Jessica Pegula sets up title clash with Sabalenka in her maiden finalJessica Pegula advanced to her first-ever final of a Grand Slam event as she beat Karolina Muchova by 1-6, 6-4, 6-2 in the second semi-final of US Open.

Watch: Harshit Rana's 'flying kiss' celebration returns after Gaikwad's wicketDuleep Trophy 2024: Harshit Rana brought back his infamous flying kiss celebration after dismissing India C captain Ruturaj Gaikwad. Harshit suffered a ban in IPL 2024 for the animated celebration.

US Open: Aryna Sabalenka unbothered to face any opponent in 2nd successive finalAryna Sabalenka is not worried about facing any opponent in the US Open final after she advanced through to the summit clash with a 6-3, 7-6 (2) victory over Emma Navarro.

Ruled out Jos Buttler 'frustrated' with injury as he works hard to get backJos Buttler was ruled out from the T20I series vs Australia and expressed his frustration on missing out on a key series. He is recovering from a right calf injury.

Aryna Sabalenka powers past spirited Emma Navarro to book final berthUS Open 2024: Aryna Sabalenka made her way through to the final at Flushing Meadows after beating USA's Emma Navarro 6-3, 7-6 (7-2) on Thursday at the Arthur Ashe Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
